meanings.definition: Not having been boarded up or covered with boards.
meanings.sent1: The windows of the house remained unboarded during the storm.
meanings.sent2: The unboarded door allowed sunlight to filter into the room.
meanings.sent3: The unboarded windows seemed to be peeking curiously at the passersby.
meanings.sent4: Her unboarded heart felt vulnerable but free.
meanings.sent5: The unboarded fence stood as a symbol of openness and welcome.

meanings.definition: Not having been taken off or removed from a board or surface.
meanings.sent1: The unboarded sign still displayed the old message.
meanings.sent2: The unboarded nail held the picture firmly in place.
meanings.sent3: The unboarded shelf stubbornly refused to let go of the books.
meanings.sent4: His unboarded skateboard became his trusted companion.
meanings.sent5: The unboarded plank creaked under their weight as they crossed.
